page.title: 06Morwenstow - R. S. Hawker
page.content: Revd. Robert Stephen Hawker (1803-75) is Morwenstow's best-known character. Vicar for 40 years, he founded{Saint {Mark's School,}built the{Old Vicarage, was responsible for the road bridge at {Coombe Valley, }reintroduced {Harvest {Festivals,}now observed throughout the country, and composed what has been described as Cornwall's national anthem,{"And shall Trelawney die?". His reputation still has an impact on the parish. There are at least four biographies; the definintive one by {Piers Brendon was published in 1975, the centenary of Hawker's death. During the festiv- ities {Lord Ramsey, }ex-archbishop of Canterbury, preached to a large con_ gregation which overflowed into the churchyard, where the sermon was re- layed by loudspeakers. Two pews were reserved for Hawker's descendants.
